src:
Qantas hentikan operasi satu pesawat Boeing 737 NG karena ada 'retakan'
01 Nov 2019, 07:52 by BBC


Qantas mengatakan mereka menemukan rekahan di salah satu pesawat Boing 737 NG mereka dan menghentikan operasi pesawat tesebut.

Maskapai Australia Qantas menghentikan operasi satu pesawat Boeing 737 NG setelah menemukan adanya 'retakan' di salah satu bagian pesawat.
Perusahaan penerbangan ini menyatakan beberapa maskapai memeriksa pesawat 737 NG mereka sesudah Boeing mengungkapkan adanya bagian pesawat yang rentan terhadap retakan.
Kantor berita AFP melaporkan sebanyak 50 pesawat jenis ini di seluruh dunia telah berhenti beroperasi disebabkan masalah tersebut.


Kecelakaan Lion Air JT-610: CEO Boeing mengaku bersalah


Boeing umumkan rangkaian perbaikan pesawat 737 Max


Pesawat 737 Max jatuh: Boeing berikan Rp1,4 triliun, keluarga korban tunggu 'keseriusan Boeing'


"Saya kehilangan semua anak saya dalam pesawat Boeing yang jatuh"


Qantas mengatakan: "Retakan itu memang ada, tetapi ini tidak berarti membahayakan keselamatan pesawat."
"Namun kami tak akan menerbangkan pesawat kecuali memang sepenuhnya aman."
Boeing mengatakan retakan itu ditemukan di daerah "garpu acar" - bagian dari pesawat yang melekatkan sayap ke badan pesawat.
Bulan lalu, pihak pengawas penerbangan Amerika Serikat memerintahkan pengecekan seluruh pesawat 737 NG yang telah menempuh lebih dari 30.000 kali penerbangan.
Qantas menyatakan tak ada pesawat 737 NG mereka yang telah terbang lebih dari 30.000 kali. Mereka menambahkan pesawat yang ditemukan mengalami retakan baru menempuh perjalanan kurang dari 27.000 kali.
Seri 737 NG ini adalah pendahulu dari seri 737 Max.
Tekanan baru buat Boeing
Masalah ini datang sesudah Boeing dipaksa untuk menghentikan operasi pesawat mereka yang lebih baru, 737 Max, menyusul dua kecelakaan yang menelan banyak korban jiwa.


Boeing klaim telah tuntaskan pemutakhiran perangkat lunak pesawat 737 Max


Boeing merugi Rp68 triliun karena larangan terbang 737 Max


Boeing ubah nama 737 Max pada pesawat pesanan maskapai Eropa


Kecelakaan Lion Air JT-610: CEO Boeing mengaku bersalah


Dua tragedi itu - di Indonesia bulan Oktober tahun lalu dan di Ethiopia bulan Maret - memakan korban jiwa sebanyak 346 orang.
Hari Rabu (30/10) Direktur Utama Boeing Dennis Muilenburg menyatakan kepada parlemen Amerika Serikat bahwa perusahaannya telah membuat kekeliruan terkait pesawat 737 Max. Pihak parlemen menuduh Boeing telah memburu-buru agar proses persetujuan bisa segera diberikan.
Qantas meyatakan mereka akan memeriksa 33 pesawat dalam armada penerbangan mereka hari Jumat (31/10). Mereka tidak merespons laporan yang menyebutkan bahwa sudah ditemukan pesawat kedua yang juga mengalami retakan di tempat yang sama.
Sebuah serikat penerbangan Australia, The Australian Licensed Aircraft Engineers Association, menyerukan kepada Qantas agar menghentikan seluruh operasi 737 NG mereka, dan seruan ini ditolak oleh Qantas karena dianggap sebagai "reaksi berlebihan".
Maskapai Amerika Serikat Southwest Airlines baru-baru ini juga menemukan retakan di salah satu pesawat Boeing 737 NG mereka.
text:
Qantas has stopped operating one Boeing 737 NG aircraft because there is a 'crack'
01 Nov 2019, 07:52 by BBC


Qantas said they found a fissure in one of their Boing 737 NG planes and stopped the operation of the aircraft.

Australian airline Qantas stopped operating a Boeing 737 NG aircraft after finding a 'crack' in one part of the plane.
The airline said several airlines inspected their 737 NG planes after Boeing revealed parts of the aircraft were vulnerable to cracks.
AFP news agency reported as many as 50 aircraft of this type worldwide have stopped operating due to the problem.


Lion Air JT-610 accident: Boeing CEO pleaded guilty


Boeing announced the 737 Max aircraft repair circuit


Max 737 crashed: Boeing gives Rp1.4 trillion, victims' families wait for 'Boeing seriousness'


"I lost all my children in a Boeing plane that crashed"


Qantas said: "There are cracks, but this does not mean that they endanger the safety of the aircraft."
"But we will not fly the aircraft unless it is completely safe."
Boeing said the crack was found in the "pickle fork" area - the part of the plane that attaches wings to the fuselage.
Last month, the United States flight inspector ordered an inspection of all 737 NG aircraft that had covered more than 30,000 flights.
Qantas said none of their 737 NG aircraft had flown more than 30,000 times. They added that the aircraft found to have had new cracks traveled less than 27,000 times.
This 737NG series is the predecessor of the Max 737 series.
New pressure for Boeing
This problem came after Boeing was forced to stop operating their newer aircraft, 737 Max, following two accidents that claimed many lives.


Boeing claims to have completed updating the 737 Max aircraft software


Boeing lost Rp68 trillion because of a 737 Max flight ban


Boeing changed the name 737 Max to a plane ordered by a European airline


Lion Air JT-610 accident: Boeing CEO pleaded guilty


The two tragedies - in Indonesia in October last year and in Ethiopia in March - claimed as many as 346 lives.
On Wednesday (30/10) President Director of Boeing Dennis Muilenburg told the US parliament that his company had made a mistake with the 737 Max. Parliament has accused Boeing of rushing it so that the approval process can be given immediately.
Qantas said they would inspect 33 planes in their flight fleet on Friday (31/10). They did not respond to reports stating that a second plane had also found a crack in the same place.
An Australian aviation union, The Australian Licensed Aircraft Engineers Association, called on Qantas to stop all their 737 NG operations, and this appeal was rejected by Qantas because it was considered an "overreaction".
The US airline Southwest Airlines recently also found a crack in one of their Boeing 737 NG aircraft.
